text: {{Infobox settlement | name = Matrouh Governorate | settlement_type = Governorate | image_flag = Matrouh Governorate-logo.PNG | flag_size = 120px | image_blank_emblem = Coat of arms of Matrouh Governorate.jpg | blank_emblem_size = 75px | image_map = Matruh_in_Egypt.svg | map_caption = Matrouh Governorate on the map of Egypt | coordinates = | subdivision_type = Country | subdivision_name = | seat = Mersa Matruh (capital) | leader_party = | leader_title = Governor | leader_name = | government_footnotes = | area_footnotes = | area_total_km2 = 212,112 | area_land_km2 = | area_water_km2 = | population_footnotes = | population_total = 441000 | population_as_of = January 2018 | population_density_km2 = auto | timezone1 = EET | utc_offset1 = +2 | timezone1_DST = | utc_offset1_DST = | website = Matrouh | iso_code = | calling_code = | footnotes = }} Matrouh Governorate is a governorate of Egypt. The capital city is Mersa Matruh. The interior of the Matrouh Governorate is part of Egypt's Western Desert, including the Siwa Oasis. In the center of the Governorate is the Qattara Depression, descending to 133 metres below sea level. Matrouh Governorate has many historical sites related to World War II. == References == Category:Governorates of Egypt
title: Matrouh Governorate
